intro: Acrolasia catalinensis, commonly known as the Catalina acrolasia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Catalina in California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal scrub habitats, thriving in well-drained sandy soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
